snippet: For the Palestinian Authority, which had sought an investigation of an Israeli military offensive, the ruling was a setback to its effort to gain international recognition as a state.
abstract: International Criminal Court’s chief prosecutor turns down a longstanding request by the Palestinian Authority to investigate accusations of Israeli war crimes during the three-week war against Hamas in Gaza that began in late 2008; for the Palestinian Authority the ruling is a setback to its effort to gain international recognition as a state.
lead_paragraph: For the Palestinian Authority, which had sought an investigation of an Israeli military offensive, the ruling was a setback to its effort to gain international recognition as a state.

headline.seo: International Criminal Court Rejects Palestinian Bid for Tribunal
headline.main: Court Rejects Palestinians in Their Bid for a Tribunal
headline.print_headline: Court Rejects Palestinians In Their Bid For a Tribunal
